content.raw:
The other problem is the speed of the movement. That causes the robot to go flailing. I just had a pose leaning forward quite a bit to examine the satellite console and did a skip to 1.4. You'd think the robot had been shot from a cannon. 

Could the physics be disabled during the re-harness move and turned back on during the lowering? Maybe hold at the top for a short period to give time for stabilization with the physics on.
